identified-content.person: Brown, Katherine Michelle Ly-Huong (Katherine Michelle Ly-Huong Cortes)

block.p: Katherine Michelle Ly-Huong Brown and Erik Edwin Cortes were married last evening at Mountainville Manor, an event space in Mountainville, N.Y. The Rev. Christina Haselfeld Wall, an interfaith minister, officiated.

Mrs. Cortes, 29, is a housing planner in Seattle for AIDS Housing of Washington. She graduated magna cum laude from Harvard. From 2002 to 2006, she was a policy analyst for the Council of State Governments' Justice Center in New York.

Katherine Michelle Ly-Huong Brown and Erik Edwin Cortes were married last evening at Mountainville Manor, an event space in Mountainville, N.Y. The Rev. Christina Haselfeld Wall, an interfaith minister, officiated.

Katherine Michelle Ly-Huong Brown and Erik Edwin Cortes were married last evening at Mountainville Manor, an event space in Mountainville, N.Y. The Rev. Christina Haselfeld Wall, an interfaith minister, officiated.

Mrs. Cortes, 29, is a housing planner in Seattle for AIDS Housing of Washington. She graduated magna cum laude from Harvard. From 2002 to 2006, she was a policy analyst for the Council of State Governments' Justice Center in New York.

She is a daughter of Bach T. Brown and David E. Brown of Hanoi, Vietnam. Her father, who retired as a counselor from the United States Foreign Service, is the program director of the EcoBoat project, an initiative of Fauna and Flora International in Ha Long Bay, Vietnam.

Mr. Cortes, 34, works in Seattle as a mobile mapping manager for Tele Atlas North America, a company based in Lebanon, N.H., that provides mapping data to portable navigation units. He graduated from Rutgers.

He is a son of Norma J. Cortes and Edwin E. Cortes of Ronkonkoma, N.Y. His mother is an account manager in Bohemia, N.Y., for Nature's Bounty, a nutritional supplement distributor. His father, who is retired, was a supervisor of distribution operations for the United States Postal Service in Bethpage, N.Y.
